intro: Sorocea racemosa, commonly known as the clustered sorocea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sorocea racemosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
